events.title: Caesar crosses the Rubicon
events.description: Julius Caesar leads his legion across the Rubicon River into Italy, effectively declaring war on the Senate and Pompey and igniting a civil war in Rome.
events.significance: Candled the start of Caesar’s civil war and ultimately the end of the Roman Republic, paving the way for Caesar’s dictatorship.

events.title: League of Nations Covenant comes into force
events.description: The Covenant of the League of Nations takes effect after ratifications by member states, establishing the international body intended to maintain peace and security.
events.significance: A landmark in the history of international diplomacy as the first global attempt at collective security and cooperation after World War I.

events.title: First meeting of the United Nations General Assembly
events.description: The United Nations General Assembly convenes for the first time at Westminster Central Hall in London, with 51 member states in attendance.
events.significance: Marks the formal birth of the United Nations and a new era of international cooperation and diplomacy.
